text: On stage, the Barden Treblemakers, an all-male a cappella group dressed in matching smoking jackets, conclude singi Universal's theme song.
The audience cheers. Then, the Trebles begin Rihanna's, “Don’t Stop The Music,” and the place goes apeshit. BARDEN TREBLEMAKERS (CONT’D)

head_text.subj: PLEASE DON'T STOP THE MUSIC, MUSIC,

text: MUSIC/PLEASE DON’T STOP THE MUSIC, MUSIC... (song continues)
CREDITS ROLL as a gorgeous girl, CHLOE (20), dressed like 1970's flight attendant, frantically rummages through a swanky dressing room.
Shitballs, where is it? Chloe stops, reaches into her jacket pocket, and pulls ou red scarf. Relieved, she DASHES out of the room.

As the BU Treblemakers sing, we WIDEN TO REVEAL: A sold o audience at Lincoln Center. The atmosphere is reminiscent an American Idol finale. PROUD PARENTS, COEDS, and A CAPPELLA FANATICS hold up signs: “I HEART BELLAS”, “I'LL TREBLE 4 YA!”, and “A CAPPELLA IS MY CO-PILOT!”
A winded Chloe runs up a set of stairs, clumsily wrapping scarf around her neck.
GAIL and JOHN, a cappella alums, color-commentate.
it.
This is exactly the type of performance you would expect to see at “The International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella.” Isn’t that right, Gail?
John, you're so right that everything else seems wrong. This is what the ICCA’s are all about. The Barden Treblemakers. The guys are crushing
The Barden University Treblemakers never disappoint. It is their showbotage that is re-defining modern a cappella. And the ladies, well, they just can’t get enough.
Yes. Nothing makes a girl feel more like a woman than a man who sings like a boy. A TREBLE steps forward to solo the next lyric.
On the word, “Away”, he goes flat.
Whoa! /Boom!
That was flatter than my ex-wife’s chest. The Asian one. [get alts]

Chloe runs past a variety of A CAPPELLA GROUPS readying themselves to compete, stopping at the all-female Bellas: group of model-esque ladies dressed exactly like her. Chl lifts up her scarf and comes face to face with Alice. (CONTINUED)
I found it! On stage the BU Treblemakers continue singing.
Chloe, look at you. You’re a mess. ALICE, the aggressive leader, undoes Chloe's scarf and th methodically re-ties it.

You’re unreliable. You’re unfocused. And your breath smells like egg. Like, all the time. Alice pushes the knot up to Chloe's throat. Chloe winces. Then, Alice turns to address both Chloe and AUBREY, an exceptionally focused girl standing next to her.
I can’t believe the Bellas are in the hands of you two slut bags after we graduate. Alice gets right up in Aubrey’s face.
Eff up your solo, and I’‘1l tell everyone you were born without a butthole and it all just comes out the front.
I won’t disappoint you. My dad always says if you’re not here to win, get the hell out of Kuwait.
The Trebles end their performance to wild applause.

With a couple of shaky notes in there, it’s anybody’s game now. Next up, BU’s other group, The Barden Bellas. BACKSTAGE: The Trebles brush past the Bellas. BUMPER, the Trebles outspoken ringleader, stops to address them. (CONTINUED)

(“genuine”) Good luck out there. Seriously. I mean that. You guys are awesome...ly horrible. I hate you. Kill yourselves. (all girly) Girl Power! Sisters before Misters! Go get ‘em gang! Bumper crosses away. An infuriated Alice turns to the lad
Now or never, bitches! HANDS IN! Alice puts her fist out. Nine others meet hers.
One, two --
(Mariah Carey-high note)
Please give it up for the Barden Bellas! The ladies run out on stage and take their position. Alic steps up to the microphone.
The Bellas. Making history as the first all-female group to ever advance to the ICCA finals.
John, why do you think it’s taken so long for an all-lady group to break through the glass ceiling of a cappella?

Well, women typically can’t hit the low notes that round out a musical arrangement and that limits them. They’re about as good at a cappella as they are at being doctors. ON STAGE: Alice blows the pitch pipe. It’s red with a lar cursive “B” on it. (CONTINUED)
One, two, three, four... They begin the arrangement and choreography to Ace of Bas ‘The Sign’. The performance is over-polished and safe.
ME, I’M SO GLAD... (song continues)
So just how did the Bellas make it to the finals?
Hard work, Gail. When it comes to the technical aspects of the performance, they never falter. Plus they are very good looking.
IT’S ENOUGH, ENOUGH.
IT’S ENOUGH TO KNOW THAT I... “The Sign” rendition has lulled the audience into a coma- state. One JUDGE even yawns.
Feels like we all just took a left turn into Snoozeville, John.
And parked in a lot where they do not validate.
At this level of competition they’re a little too traditional, don’t you think? No surprise factor.
Yes. It’s like after nine years of marriage knowing exactly what my Orthodox Jewish wife will be wearing to bed. (CONTINUED)
The wig, John?
And the wool skirt. John and Gail wince. Aubrey steps up to solo.

head_text.subj: UNDER THE PALE MOON WHERE I SEE A

text: LOT OF STARS/IT’S ENOUGH TO KNOW/I SAW THE SIGN AND IT OPE(NED)... Aubrey projectile PUKES and we FREEZE. The puke hangs the frozen in mid-air. TITLE CARD: PITCH PERFECT. END OPENING CREDITS.
We hear Kansas’s, “Carry On Wayward Son” as a Prius trave down the highway, passing a sign: “Barden Univ., Next Exi TITLE CARD: FOUR MONTHS LATER.

Move-In Day. GREETERS in polo shirts direct traffic. A ta pulls up carrying BECA MITCHELL, a pretty freshman with heavy eyeliner. Beca listens to a dub step remix of Sia’s “Titanium” on a pair of DJ-style headphones.
(super chipper) Hi there! Welcome to Barden University. What dorm? Beca takes off her headphones.
Baker Hall, I think. The Greeter pulls out a map.

Okay, here's what you're going to do. Take that first right... The Prius pulls into BU. A MOM drives and a DAD sits shotgun. JESSE, a confident underdog with boyish good loo sits in the back and sings “Wayward” out the window. (CONTINUED)
10 All 11
The Prius pulls right along side Beca’s taxi, near the greeters. Beca turns to see Jesse singing in the backseat They lock eyes. You think he'll stop singing. He doesn’t.
Beca stares in confused wonderment as Jesse continues to sing. After a beat, the Prius pulls away. The Greeter’s voice snaps Beca back to reality.
+. And your official BU rape whistle. Don’t blow it unless it’s actually happening. Nobody likes that. Beca reluctantly takes the whistle as the taxi pulls away

On the lawn, FRAT GUYS use numbered paddles to rate the Freshmen girls as they walk by. A GAY COUPLE helps their unload IKEA-like furniture from a mini-van. Beca takes it in, not looking particularly enthused. OMIT All
Beca’s shy, KOREAN ROOMMATE is already there. She sits at the edge of her bed, silent.
You must be Kimmy Jin. I’m Beca. KIMMY JIN just stares back. Awkward. (CONTINUED)
No English? Yes English? Just tell me where you’re at on English?
Jesse stands outside the Prius with two large duffel bags His mom won’t release him from a long embrace.
Okay. Can’t breath. Mom lets go. Dad hugs him just as hard.
Here we go.
Kimmy Jin hasn’t moved. Beca nervously talks as she unzip her suitcase, pulling out a set of turn-tables and assort deejay equipment.

(re: equipment) Well, this is it. My music is everything to me, Kimmy Jin. So please don’t touch, cool? Like ever, okay? Kimmy Jin just stares. Beca tries to read her for a momen BECA (CONT’D) It is extremely important to me that you acknowledge this interaction.
Jesse opens the door to find BENJI APPLEBAUM hanging a Ti Fighter mobile over his bed. Benji’s a benevolent nerd wh makes Jesse look studly by comparison.
There he is. You must be Jesse. (CONTINUED)

And you must be kidding. WIDEN TO REVEAL: A room decorated with huge amounts of sc memorabilia: A life-sized Darth Vader, a twenty-sided die chair, a Battlestar tribute wall, and a big box with swor sticking through it. A beat, as Jesse and Benji take it i
Looking at it now, I can see that it’s a lot. I’11 take it down --
No way! Took me a second for my eyes to adjust but I can roll with this.
Just so you know. I’m not a total nerd. I also happen to be super into close-up magic. Benji pulls a hamster out of his sleeve.
Dude! That’s awesome! Benji nods, “I’m pretty good.” Then:

How long was the little guy in there? INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - CONTINUOUS 15 Beca finishes converting her desk into a musical workstat (Turntables, keyboard, laptop). There’s a KNOCK on the do A MAN speaks in falsetto.
It’s Missy, your R.A! You guys keep it down in there! Beca opens the door to reveal DR. FRANCIS MITCHELL, (49), sweet-faced man with JFK hair and a corduroy blazer.
I'm kidding. It’s just your ol’ man trying to make a funny. (CONTINUED)
(sarcastic) Chris Rock, everybody. Dr. Mitchell enters. Kimmy Jin is still sitting there.
(to Kimmy Jin) Hi. Dr. Francis Mitchell, Beca’s dad. I’m a professor here... (beat)
There’s no response. Dr Mitchell turns back to Beca. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) So when did you get here? How did you get here?
Took a cab from the airport. Didn't want to inconvenience you and Sheila. How is the stepmonster?
She’s great. She’s on her way to Vegas. Never been before. Gave her my lucky...
Don’t really care, dad. Just wanted to say “stepmonster.”
Fair enough. Well do I at least get a hug? It’s been a while since I've seen you!
Dr. Mitchell forces a hug on Beca. Beca doesn't hug back.
Well, that’s what happens when you leave your wife and daughter and move 3000 miles away for some hooker. +e * HF
(to Kimmy) Sheila’s a pharmaceutical sales rep. That's very different than a hooker. So, you been on the quad yet?
(MORE) (CONTINUED)
In the springtime, students study on the grass.
I don’t want to study on the grass. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
I don’t need college. What I need is to live in LA, work at a music label, start paying my dues --
Oh boy. Here we go again. Beca, DJ’‘ing is not a profession. It’s a hobby. Unless you’re Rick Dees or someone awesome like that --
I don’t want to just deejay. I want to produce music. Make music --
You're getting a college education. For free, I might add. End of story.
Great. So instead of getting real world experience in what I actually want to do with my life, I'll spend four years studying on the grass. There’s an awkward beat of silence.
I’m going to the Activities Fair. She speaks. Beca is surprised but seizes the opportunity.
Well then so am I. I’m going to go with my super-good friend, Kimmy Jin. Beca grabs her bag and they exit, leaving Dr. Mitchell.  16 17 12.

A series of recruiting booths are set up throughout the q Anything and everything is represented: One booth reads, Word: A Collection of Feminist Voices,” another says, “Ba Newspaper,” another reads “Dudes With Ponytails. Est. 198 Beca, headphones around her neck, and Kimmy Jin are at th booth: “RIAC: Running in a Circle.” Two REPRESENTATIVES g Beca the hard sell.
Basically what we do is we join arms in a large ring and we run clockwise and sometimes we’ll do variations on that.
It’s really about movement and, health, circulation, mimicking the earth’s orbit around the sun.
So you run around in a circle?
And so can you. He holds out a pen for Beca to sign up.
Yeah. I’m gonna look around --
-- Around!
You would do so well here. Kimmy Jin spots the “Korean Students Association” booth a makes a beeline for it. The KOREAN STUDENTS welcome her w open arms. Beca, now alone, puts her headphones on.
ACROSS THE FAIR: Jesse and Benji stride through, stopping the gratuitously rowdy Sigma Beta Theta FRAT booth. Good- looking, bare-chested, beefy GUYS party and chant.
“Drinking beer, smoking dope, sucking on a tit! (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
If you ain’t pledging SBT, then you ain’t worth no shit!”
That’s a double negative.
That’s a lot of negatives.

Follow me. There’s only one group on this campus worth joining. NEEDLE DROP: A HEAVY GUITAR LICK kicks in as the camera F over the fair, table after table, finally landing on... THE Barden Treblemakers: A motley crew of eight confident nerds sitting under a tree: DONALD, a cool dude with blac glasses, UNICYCLE, a guy always astride a unicycle, a few other thin, unathletic DWEEBS, and BUMPER, the outspoken ringleader. Jesse and Benji stand nearby. Benji gestures to the guys.

As far as Barden goes, that’s what being a man is all about. Bumper blows an iPhone pitch pipe. The Trebles suddenly r and sing the gayest version of The Dazz Band’s “Let It Wh Amazingly, a HANDFUL OF PRETTY GIRLS gather around to lis
The Treblemakers. The rock stars of a cappella, the messiahs of Barden. Well, you know, not including athletes, frat guys, or actual cool people.
Organized nerd singing! Is this for real?
You bet it is. How’s your voice? Jesse joins the Trebles in “Let It Whip.” Benji’s impress
Aubrey and Chloe stand in front of their tiny “Bellas” bo handing out flyers. Aubrey scoffs at the Trebles. (CONTINUED)
I will stop at nothing to take down those dicklicks. [ALT: suck butts] A homely girl, BARB, walks up.
Hey, Barb! Gonna audition this year? We have openings. Chloe tries to hand her a flier but Barb won’t take it.

Oh, now that you’ve puked your way to the bottom, you might actually consider me? I’ve auditioned three times and never got in because you said my boobs look like baloney. Barb puts her hands on her hips. Her cardigan is pulled b revealing two huge, baloney-like areolas beneath her t-sh
The word’s out. The Bellas’s are the laughing stock of a cappella. Good look recruiting this year, douche-b’s. Barb leaves. Chloe looks a tad shaken.
This. Is. (singing)
(then) If we can’t recruit Baloney Barb, we can’t get anybody.
Take the dramatics down a notch.
You're the one who got us into this hot mess!

We'll be fine. I’m confident we’ll find eight super-hot girls with bikini ready bodies who can harmonize and have perfect pitch. A PACK OF HOT GIRLS walk by. Aubrey offers a flyer. They PUSH her away and keep walking. Aubrey dons her “game fac (CONTINUED)
Keep flyering. We have a tradition to uphold.

How about we just get good singers. A chubby GIRL walks up and takes a flier from Chloe. CHLOE (CONT’D) CHUBBY GIRL Hi! Can you sing? Yep. Can you read music? Yep. Can you match pitch? Chloe sings three notes. The girl matches them, perfectly
You want me to do it in “A’?
Your name?
Fat Amy.
You call yourself Fat Amy?
Yep. So you twig bitches don’t do it behind my back.
See you at auditions... Fat Amy. Fat Amy walks away.

That was oddly satisfying. ANGLE ON: Beca, who has now stopped at a booth called “CA DJ'S". She excitedly picks up a flier. It reads: “BARDEN DJ's ("Deaf Jews. A Club For The Hearing Impaired Childre of Israel.”) Beca reacts, bummed. Fat Amy walks up as a JEWISH STUDENT signs and mumbles excitedly.
Shalom! (CONTINUED)
(loudly, to Student) That’s not a real word! Keep trying! You’ll get it!
(laughs, to Fat Amy) Not a lot of Jewish people where you're from, huh? Beca continues on, passing near the Bella booth. Chloe se Beca and points her out to Aubrey.
Hey, what about her? She could be made cute.
Are you blind, Chloe? That girl’s a freak. She’s so not a Bella. Ignoring her, Chloe hands Beca a flyer. Beca takes off he headphones. Beca eyes
Hi! Any interest in auditioning for our a capella group? the flier, then Chloe and Aubrey.
A capella. Oh right, this is a thing now.
Totes. We sing covers of songs but do it without any instruments. (over sell) It all comes from our mouths! Beca reacts, “Wow.”

There are four groups on campus. the Bellas. That’s us. We’re the tits. The BU Harmonics... THE BU HARMONICS BOOTH: A CO-ED GROUP where HOMELY GIRLS, including Barb, give back rubs to GUYS who don’t k they’re gay yet.
The High Notes. (CONTINUED)
ANGLE ON: THE HIGH NOTES: A GROUP that’s always high. A couple of them laugh too hard. Three or four fall over.
Their, um, not particularly motivated. And then there’s -- ANGLE ON: The Treblemaker’s big finish.

LET IT WHIP! (LET’S WHIP IT BABY) Beca watches as The Trebles bow to applause. In the distance, she spots Jesse and recognizes him as the “Sing guy in the Prius.” Just then, a stray football hits Uni i the head, knocking him to the ground. BACK TO the ladies. Beca grabs the flier, revealing a tattoo: A preying manth Chloe sees this.
Hey! I have a tattoo!
Oh yeah?
I sorta went through a punk phase. I was listening to a lot of “Evanescence.” Beca reacts,”0O...kay.”
(hopeful) So are you interested?
I don’t know. Seems pretty lame. Hearing this, Aubrey steps up to Beca.
Aca-scuse me? Synchronized lady dancing to a “Mariah Carey”-chart topper is not lame.
We sing all over the world and compete in national championships.
On purpose? (CONTINUED)
We played the Cobb Energy Performing Arts Center you bitch! Beca reacts, “Settle.” Chloe plays peacekeeper.

What Aubrey means to say is that we're a close-knit, talented group of ladies whose dream is to return to the national finals at Lincoln Center this year. (offering sign up sheet) Help us turn our dreams into a reality?
(to Chloe) Sorry, I'm not really a singer so... It was nice meeting you. Beca walks away. Aubrey starts to lose it.
What are we going to do?! The Bellas are finished! Our lives are ov[er]-- (recoils and covers mouth) Uhp. Wait, I got it.
Did you almost vomit again?
Yeah. It’s the stress.
You need some water?
No. It didn’t come up that far.
Benji and Jesse walk towards The Trebles.
I’m going to introduce myself. (covering nervousness) Everybody be cool. It’s just a normal day... (CONTINUED)
Benji approaches Bumper and the gang.
Hi. Benjamin Applebaum. He firmly shakes Bumper’s hand.
I saw you guys perform at the “Mall of America” like three years ago. Changed my life. Haven’t stopped thinking about you since.
Thanks, man.
Hey, vagina! Throw the ball back! Uni throws the ball back like a little girl, loses his balance, and once again falls to the ground, hard.

Bumper, huge fan. Your arrangement of Lovin’ Spoonful’s “Do You Believe in Magic” inspired me to become a certified illusionist. Benji stuffs a red scarf into his fist, and then holds up empty hands. A little piece of the scarf protrudes from Benji’s enormous fake thumb. He fails the trick a couple times. Bumper just stares.
(to the gang) I feel like I’m too important for this. [ALT: The smell of your “weird” is affecting my vocal chords.” ]
You are.
So why don’t we exchange emails or maybe totally hang out right now?
Too far. Jesse grabs Benji and hurries him away. (CONTINUED)
BACK ON: Beca at the CAMPUS INTERN booth. She grabs an application for the “Campus Radio Station,” puts on her headphones and we DISSOLVE TO:
Beca crosses a street and enters the campus radio station

A hot MASHUP-STYLE REMIX pumps as we’re tight on Beca, he eyes transfixed. BECA’S POV: Inside the deejay booth is LUKE, the smoking-hot, tattooed Station Manager. Beca’s smitten. The guy, the music... Everything. After a beat, Luke turns, catching Beca staring. He smile lowers the volume, and opens the deejay booth door.
Hey. You been there long?
(flustered) Um, no, I was, uh... I just got here. Like now. I wasn’t standing here for a while or anything... She awkwardly approaches the booth. Luke stands, official
Sorry, but freshman aren’t allowed in the booth. He steps out and extends his hand. She shakes it like a nerd. LUKE (CONT’D) Luke. Station Manager. You must be Beca. Jesse enters, in a rush.
And I’m Jesse.
I’m Luke. And you're late. (CONTINUED)
Jesse turns to Beca. A look of realization crosses his fa
Hey, I know you!
No, you don’t. (to Luke, pointed) He doesn’t.
Okay. You two can figure it out while you’re stacking CD's. Luke points to several crates of CD’s.

When you’re done, there’s more. You're gonna be spending a lot of time together, so please... No sex on the desk. I’ve been burned before. Luke exits back into the booth. Beca watches him, then exhales heavily.

I do know you. I sang to you. I remember because you were in a taxi. Wait, is your dad a taxi driver? Ignoring him, Beca starts stacking CD’s. He follows suit. Beca steals a glance at Luke. Jesse clocks this.
So... Luke’s attractive. Excellent bone-structure. Full head of hair. Fancy undershirt. I think we just met my nemesis. Beca, frustrated, plops down behind the desk.
Man, this sucks. I came here to play music, not stack it.
Not me. I’m here for one reason only. I love stackin’ cd’s. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

I was offered a job at a lab that tests the effects of marijuana on your appetite but I said no. I want to stack cd’s, hopefully in the vicinity of a semen smeared desk -- That’s what we think happened here, right?
(playing along) Too bad I didn’t bring my black light. Then we'd know for sure.
So what’s your deal? You one of those girls who’s all dark and mysterious until she takes off her glasses and that amazingly scary ear spike and you realize she was beautiful the whole time?
I don’t wear glasses.
Then you’re halfway there. (re: stacking) I am loving this.
You're a weirdo.
Yes I am. And so are you. It’s a good thing we’re going to be best friends and/or lovers.
Please don’t say “lovers.”
You know, I wouldn’t pass this up. Once I’m a Treble, I probably won’t have time for you.
You know, I didn’t think you could find a way to be less attractive to me, but congrats, you just did. (CONTINUED)
Ha! You're terrific. Just wait. You'll go all squidy and drape yourself all over me. It’1l be fun. You'll see. Beca reacts, “Who is this guy?”

Beca sits alone, eating. She scans the quad, noticing the SBT guys happily playing ultimate frisbee. Next to them, group of SCIENCE NERDS enjoy studying. Then, the “Running a Circle” group literally runs in a circle and loves it. [SLOW MOTION] Feeling the pangs of loneliness, Beca puts headphones on, lies down, and finds solace in Sia.
I’M BULLETPROOF/NOTHING TO LOSE/FIRE AWAY, FIRE AWAY... FADE TO BLACK. Over black, we hear -
Beca? Beca? Wake up, Beca...

INT. BECA’S DORM ROOM - THE NEXT DAY 29 Beca is in bed, asleep. ANGLE ON: A hand, unplugging the headphones plugged into her computer. Once unplugged, the music plays loudly (TITANIUM). Beca JOLTS awake. REVEAL: Dr. Mitchell, trying to turn the music off. He can’t. Bec unamused, gets out of bed and does it for him.
This doesn’t look like your “Intro to Philosophy” class.
I’m posing an important philosophical question: If I don’t actually go to class, will that class still suck? (CONTINUED)
Beca sits down, and fiddles with some equipment. *

Okay, I know you’re mad at me. I get it. But I can’t just let you waste your life in this room while you fiddle around with technical equipment I know nothing about. For God sake, you look like a roadie from (mispronouncing) Def Lep-paard!
I don’t understand why you won’t support me?
The music industry is a seedy place, Bec. I mean, have you seen * those VH1 Behind the Musics?
Man, ever since you got cable --

College is the transition period that prepares you for all the scary things life is gonna throw at you. * You create memories here. I see it everyday. Beca, you've been * here a month. Do you even have any * friends? *
Kimmy Jin is my friend. REVEAL: Kimmy Jin, quietly studying in a corner.
Nope. (CONTINUED)
Just try something. Put yourself out there.
I just got a job at the radio station
I’ve seen that place. It’s dark and dirty and has what? Three weirdos working there?
Well, four, now.

Beca, this is the time in your life to try new things, explore. Not be so fixated on this DJ thing. He points to the audition flier on her desk. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) Like that. Do that. Or run ina circle. Wait, don’t do that. Those kids aren't right. Just do something new. And if in a year, you still don’t want to be here. If you still want to try to be some big time music producer, then... (at a loss) You can quit college and I’1l help you move to LA.
(brightens ) Whoa, whoa. Seriously?

Yes. Seriously. But I need to really see it, Bec. You got to get out there. Make friends. Join in. This is college! Beca lingers on the audition notice. She grabs a towel an her toiletries basket and heads into the...
es + eH +e * HF
In one stall, we see two pairs of feet. There’s whisperin
You said we'd try it.
I’1ll get electrocuted!
How? Beca walks in, holding a shower caddy and singing Sia’s “Titanium.” She looks upbeat in a way we haven’t seen before. The feet freeze. (CONTINUED)
Beca doesn’t notice them, gets into another stall, and tu the water on. As she waits for the water to warm, the cam pans over Beca’s shoulder. REVEAL: Chloe, listening, all- smiles. Then:
You can sing! Beca SCREAMS and attempts to cover her bits with her loof
How high does your belt go?
My what?!
The tone of your voice is beautiful. You have to audition for the Bellas! Beca grabs a shampoo bottle and holds it over her chest.
I can’t concentrate on anything you're saying til you cover your junk.
Just consider it. One time we sang back up for Prince. His butt is so tiny, I can hold it with one hand. [get alts] Beca closes the curtain. Chloe opens it again.
Seriously, I am nude.
You were singing “Titanium” right?
(pulled up) You know David Guetta?
What, have I been living under a rock? That song is my jam. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
(coyly) My “diddle” jam.
That’s nice.
Yeah it is! That song builds. (then) Sing it for me?
Ew! No! Get the hell out of here!
Not for that reason! Look, I’m not leaving here until you sing so...
This is ridiculous.
Maybe. (defiant) But I can stand here all day. Beca rolls her eyes. Then, reluctantly starts
Chloe jumps in, harmonizing. They sound awesome.

head_text.subj: BRICK OF SHAME TAKE YOUR AIM/FIRE
AWAY, FIRE AWAY/YOU SHOOT ME DOWN

text: BUT I WON’T FALL/I AM TITANIUM/YOU SHOOT ME DOWN BUT I WON’T FALL/I AM TITANIUM. 27. 30 singing. Beca finds herself unexpectedly moved. There’s a long beat of them looking at each other, naked.
Yeah, I’m pretty confident about... (motions around her body) All this.
You should be. Chloe hands Beca a towel. Then, Tom pops into frame. (CONTINUED)
You have a lovely voice.
Thanks? An awkward moment. Chloe pulls Tom out. Beca stands there stunned. PUSH IN ON Beca, smiling, a look of realization crosses her face. We move TIGHTER on Beca, and PRE-LAP...
Listen up, everybody. For your audition, each of you will sing...
Audition day. In the hallway outside the auditorium, a lo line of CO-ED’S warm up their voices. TOMMY MARTIN and hi sidekick JUSTIN, a cappella super-fans address the group.
+. Sixteen bars of Kelly Clarkson's “Since U Been Gone.” If a group likes you, they’1ll contact you directly. My tone deaf sidekick Justin will collect your info.
If I could carry a tune in any possible human way, I would. But I can’t. I resent myself dearly.

I've been picked on, wedgied, ridiculed, upper-decked, and cyber- bullied by elected officials. I am also currently failing out of this university. And though I too cannot sing a drop, there is nowhere I'd rather be than in the welcome embrace of Barden a cappella. But if you think this is like some high school club where you sing and dance your way through big social issues you’ve come to the wrong place. It’s nothing like that. That’s high school. This shit is real life.
Real life!! (CONTINUED)
(He claps twice) Alright people. Don’t just bring it! Sing it!
All four a cappella groups are there. The Trebles sit in back. Aubrey and Chloe sit in front. (CONTINUED)

Hey Bellas, remember how you tried to play in the big leagues and choked? Let that be a lesson to everybody. Sing the same girlie shit every year, you’1ll blow chunks all over the place. The rest of the Trebles snicker. Donald does a “too slow” slap to himself. Aubrey braces herself, then stands to address the room.

My fellow aca-people. As most of you know, it is a make or break year for the Bella ladies. But make no mistake. We will not let egotistical, big-headed, garbage dicks, whoever they may be, get in our way. (then, to Bumper) I promise you. The Bellas will return to the ICCA’s and finish what we started last year. Tommy steps in, getting down to business.
First up today... He presents CYNTHIA ROSE, a butch looking girl wearing a leather jacket and boots.
Whenever you’re ready, dude.

Hi, my name’s Cynthia Rose. ANGLE ON: Donald, reacting, “Oops.” CYNTHIA ROSE (CONT’D) (begins singing) BUT SINCE U BEEN GONE... BEGIN “AMERICAN IDOL”-TYPE AUDITION MONTAGE: -- We see QUICK POPS of AUDITIONERS. Some good, some bad. -- A smart-looking plain-faced girl wearing Tina-Fey glas introduces herself as MARY ELISE. She has an adequate voi -- More AUDITIONERS. (CONTINUED)

-- Jesse nails his audition. -- More AUDITIONERS. Sprinkled in, we meet four quirky, awkward ladies named JESSICA, ASHLEY, DENISE, and KORI. -- Fat Amy walks on stage and takes the mic. She’s crazy loud, but great.

Hi. My name is Stacie. My hobbies are cuticle care and the E! Network. (then, singing) I'M SO MOVING ON, YEAH, YEAH... When Stacie sings, she closes her eyes and makes a strang “Jessica Simpson” weird singing face. It’s disturbing. Okay. That’s everybody. Chloe hears the exit door OPEN and sees Beca peeking in.

I didn’t have time to prepare the song.
It’s okay! Sing anything! Beca sings a kick-ass version of “MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE,” while playing the cups.
YOU'RE GONNA MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE YOU'RE GONNA MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE OH I KNOW/YOU’RE GONNA MISS ME WHEN I’M GONE... Applause. REVEAL: Jesse, in the wings, loving it.
A series of red hoods are pulled off ten girls. Aubrey re off the name of each girl as her hood comes off.

The Sopranos: Jessica, Mary Elise, Lilly. The Mezzos: Cynthia Rose, Denise, Kori. And our Altos: Fat Amy, Stacie, Ashley, and... Beca. As Beca’s hood is pulled off, she looks totally disorient FROM BECA'S POV: The ladies stand in a room lit by a hazardous amount of candles. (CONTINUED)
On a table rests a chalice of wine and ten red scarves. Aubrey and Chloe stand before them in Bella attire. Aubre blows the pitch pipe.

As your music director and possessor of the pitch pipe, I'd like to welcome you to the Bellas’ initiation night. We shall begin by drinking the blood of the sisters that came before you. Chloe grabs the chalice and presents it to Beca.
Hell no.
It’s tradition.
(whispers ) Don't worry. It’s Boone’s Farm. Beca takes the chalice, barely taking a sip.
Brown hoods are removed from the heads of Jesse and Kolio JESSE'S POV: The Trebles sit around in smoking jackets. A hot tub sits in the middle of the room. Bumper approaches
Well, well. Look who’s in “Treble.”
Classic pun. Jesse looks around.
Where’s Benji? Donald crosses over and hands Jesse a smoking jacket.
This is your Treble jacket. We wear these when we perform. On stage. And in bed. (CONTINUED)
It means you’re one of us. A brother forever.
I don’t know what to say. I’11l never lose this.
You can. We have more. It’s nota big deal.

Uh, it’s kind of a big deal. Pretty big deal. I don’t like it when you undermine me. (then) Okay, time to prove your Treble loyalty by getting stupid-drunk while committing a minor felony. (Timberlake falsetto) LET’S ROCK IT TO THE BREAK OF DONG!
(to no one inparticular) He’s like a male Josh Groban.
Now, if you’ll all place your scarf in your right hand. Chloe and Aubrey demonstrate with their scarves.
I, sing your name.

Promise to fulfill the duties and responsibilities of a Bella woman. (repeat) Neither sickness, nor midterms, nor my lady times will prevent me from her-monizing with my sisters. (repeat) And I solemnly promise never to have sexual relations with a Treblemaker or may my vocal chords be ripped out by wolves. (CONTINUED)
They look around to each other, struggling to repeat it.
You are all Bellas now. All but Beca erupt in cheers. Chloe turns to Aubrey.
We did it.
(looks around, concerned) Did we?

The Trebles stand in front of a van whose license plate r “TNHNGRS.” On the side of the van, there’s a magnetic dec of four guys: professional, elder-statesmen of a cappella Helms-types). Jesse and Kolio spray paint the van a neon blue color while chugging beers.
Every year, the Tone Hangers come back to party on initiation night. And every year we mess with their van.
When are these losers going to realize nobody should be singing a cappella after college? There’s just some things you should give up before you start to look sad. Uni unicycles into frame.
Totally.
The “Hood Night” party. Justin mans the kegs as the aca- groups and their new recruits all file in. The Bellas, le by Aubrey, walk up together. Beca, Fat Amy, and Stacie br up the rear.
Ladies, prepare to soften the beach. (CONTINUED)
The ladies, react, “huh.”
(to Fat Amy) What am I doing here?
Livin’ the dream! I still can’t believe they let my fat ass in.
Me too! For some reason, girls are usually threatened by me. Stacie WHIPS off her top exposing a smokin’ body. Jesse, drunk, stumbles up to Beca.
Beca. Beca... (like a chicken) Be-caw! Be-caw! Are my eyes deceiving me? Jesse wipes his eyes and makes sgeaking noises.
You're a Bella?! Think of all the memories we’re going to create together!
And you're drunk! You won’t remember anything tomorrow. Beca does something physical to Jesse. (i.e. Punches him.
(laughing) Oh no she didn’t! Beca shakes her head and laughs. Aubrey clocks this. A tipsy Chloe gives Beca a big hug and puts her face right close.
I’m so glad I met you! I know we're going to be fast friends.
Yeah, I mean, you’ve seen me naked. Hard not to bond after that. (CONTINUED)
everybody 36.

And don’t you worry about Aubrey. She's a good girl. Her parents just never took her out of the shrink wrap. (then, yelling) Okay, Mama's thirsty! [get alts] ANGLE ON: Cynthia Rose and Stacie, talking.
If I drink too much tonight, will you promise to hold my hair back when I puke?

(a beat, taking Stacie in) Yes. Yes, I can be trusted to do that. ANGLE ON: Bumper and Donald filling their cups at the keg NEEDLEDROP: Andy Grammer’s “Keep Your Head Up” comes on a SCREAMS! They all sing along.
Who would win in a fight? Captain America or a great white shark.
Great white shark.
Nuh-uh.

Yes huh. All the shark has to do is lure him to international waters. Captain America has no jurisdiction out there. Next question. Who is easiest to sleep with? Captain America or a great white shark...? Fat Amy walks up.
What are you turds talking about?
You are the single grossest human I've ever laid eyes on. (CONTINUED)

Bec casually strolls into the room. Aubrey, still facing the board, freezes, and then writes Beca’s name on the board a tally mark next to it. Beca rolls her eyes.

Dixie Chicks-serious. You can fool around with anyone you want, just not a Treble.

Stacie, the Trebles don’t respect us. They treat us like we’re one big joke. And if we let them penetrate us, we’re giving them our power.
Not a good enough reason to use the word penetrate. Aubrey moves toward Mary Elise.
Anybody have anything to confess? Mary Elise crumbles under the pressure and nods, yes.

But... it was an accident. It landed in my hand. Aubrey doesn’t waver. Mary Elise stands up to leave, slowly. Every few steps, she looks back, desperately to be stopped. She grabs a chair and drags it across floor. She finally leaves, crying loudly through the

45 very wanting the hall. (CONTINUED)
We only have four months til regionals so if you have a problem with how I run the Bell--ah! (recoils and covers mouth) Oh God.

We PULL BACK to reveal Lilly holding up her ipad while th new Bellas watch in awe. Aubrey’s grief-stricken by the memory. Stacie leans into Lilly.

I do! She “Beatboxes.” It’s not great. There’s a lot of spit involved. ANGLE ON: Lilly watching her intently.
So that would be a “no.” We practice everyday for at least two hours. Seven days a week. We trust you'll add your own cardio.

Why cardio? I’11 tell you -- (sings) WHYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY... They wait for her to stop. She doesn’t

This is a list of all the songs we've ever performed. You’ll notice that we only do songs made famous by women. Beca looks disdainfully at the list. (CONTINUED)

Because we don’t stray from tradition. Our focus is perfecting our repertoire. It’s why we’re the best all-female group in the country. Now, let’s start with some vocal warm-ups, practice scales, followed by arpeggios and then work our way up to choreography. Any questions?
You said scales and then something about spaghettios? [get alts]

- Mic technique - All but Fat Amy run the stairs. - Teaching moments to learn how to make instrument sounds with their mouths. - Learn how to dance in heals. -- Dr. Mitchell looks through the rehearsal door’s window He smiles, pleased. - Rehearsal of beatboxing. Failing miserably. - Choreography of each person trying to do a specific ste - Dealing with Stacie’s bad singing face. (CONTINUED)
You're only going to do bump, bump, ba bump... END MONTAGE.

Nothing. I hear nothing.

(ignoring her) Don't forget to pick up your performance schedules. We have a gig next week. That’s right. Next week.

You're not in charge of me, Aubrey.

What are nodes?
Vocal Nodules. The rubbing together of your vocal cords at above-average rates without proper lubrication.
They sit on your windpipe and crush your dreams.
Isn't that painful? Why would you keep performing?
Because I love to sing.
It’s like when my lady doctor told me not to have sex for six weeks and I did it anyway.
You should really listen to your doctor.
(overly-dramatic) The key is early diagnosis. I’m living with nodes. I’m a survivor. I just have to pull back. Because I’m limited. Because I have nodes.
And the Oscar goes to... [get alts]

(laughs ) What’s all this? (CONTINUED)

As much as I love spending time with you stacking cd’s. And I do, like, more than life. I thought we could do other fun things that wouldn’t make us want to kill ourselves. Jesse pulls out a stack of dvd’s from his duffle.

“Up,” “Slumdog,” “Breakfast Club,” “Star Wars,” and “Rocky.” Best scored and sound-tracked movies of all time. (then) That’s what I want to do when I grow up. Score movies. Bring people to tears. Blow people’s minds. Only music can do that. Beca’s interest is piqued.
Wow. You must sweep your girlfriend off her feet.
I don’t have a girlfriend.
(mock aghast) What? But you have juice boxes and “Rocky”!
Okay. Fair enough. Not all of us can be Luke. Man that guy looks great in a fedora.

I don’t like how much cooler he thinks he is than me. Even if he is, in fact, much cooler than me. (then, holding up a dvd) What do you want to watch first? Beca looks through the dvd’s and furrows her brow. (CONTINUED)
Umm... Maybe we could do something else like talk about our feelings or go to the gynecologist?
What, you don’t like movies? Beca shrugs. Jesse is beside himself.
Any movies?
I watched a porno at a high school party once. The music was okay if you're big into sax solos --
What is wrong with you? Not liking movies is like not liking...shapes!
I mean, they’re fine. But I get bored and never make it to the end.
The endings are the best part!
Hey, you don’t have to cry. It’s just they’re so predictable. The guy gets the girl, the kid sees dead people, Darth Vader is Luke’s father...
Right. You just happened to guess the biggest reveal in cinematic history.
Vader in German means father. His name is Darth Father. Jesse puts his DVD's back into his duffle.
Huh, you know German. Well, now I see why you don’t like fun things. Beca smiles, pretty pleased with herself. (CONTINUED)
You need a movie education.
I'd have to schedule it around Bellas rehearsals which are always.
Getting ready for the riff-off?
What the hell’s a riff-off?

We PAN OVER an empty swimming pool filled with Barden’s a cappella groups, partying. The Trebles hold court. A crowd of fans have formed around the pool. STUDENTS sca ladders to get into the pool area. Across the pool, Jesse joins Benji.

Cut off.

Cut off.

I’m taking you down. (CONTINUED)

OH MICKEY YOU’RE SO FINE YOU’RE SO FINE YOU BLOW MY MIND...

You're missing the ending. (CONTINUED)

(out-of-breath) I should have taken that cardio tip more seriously.

I can’t. It’s impossible. Because of... (CONTINUED)
My nodes. Your nodes.

Oh, I’1l1 solo. On one condition. We pick a new song and I get to do the arrangement. Bec!” A direct challenge to Aubrey. The girls shift, uneasy.
That’s not how we do things here.
Aubrey, maybe Beca’s right. Maybe we should try something new.
Aca-what?! (to Beca) You will be singing “Turn the Beat Around” and that’s the last I want to hear of this.

Let me explain this to you because you still don’t seem to understand. Our goal is to get back to the finals. These songs will get us there. So excuse me if I don’t take advice from some alt girl with her Mad Lib beats when she’s never even been in a competition. Have I made myself clear?

Jesse and Beca are stacking cd’s. Luke’s in the booth. We see a PHYSICAL CAT & MOUSE GAME: THE STACKING OF CD’S. JE TRYING TO MAKE BECA LAUGH. Luke shakes his head, “What dummy’s.” After a while -

You want me to get you lunch. You should lay off the burgers though. (re: Luke’s tight abs) You won't be twenty-two forever. Luke lifts his shirt. (CONTINUED)
I think I’m good.
("on board”) He’s good. He’s real good. Jesse looks Luke in the eyes.
And the chess match continues. Jesse reluctantly goes. Beca grabs a memory stick off the desk and hands it to Luke.
Here. This is my latest mix. Maybe you’1l play this one?
Yeah, okay, thanks. I/’11 put it with the others.

I could eat these everyday.
You do. Jinx, bitch! Double jinx! Buy me a coke! Holy crap! Call Guinness! Shit! Oh my God!!
Donald's car pulls up. Guys load onto the Trebles “tricke out” bus. Some Trebles, including Jesse, are already insi when Benji jumps on board.
Can I hitch a ride? I'd take my car, but... I don’t have one. The Trebles just stare at Benji. After a beat, Jesse gets and gently escorts Benji off the bus.
Benji, I’m sorry. I think only Trebles can ride the bus. It’s pretty much a rule.
Of course. Good luck tonight. Benji walks away. Jesse shakes his head, “Poor guy.”  64.
Fat Amy fills up the Bella’s van, while Lilly, Cynthia Ro and Beca keep warm inside.
Don’t you flat butts worry. I got this. My thighs are like Gore-Tex. We INTERCUT with The Treble’s bus cruising toward the gas station. Bumper sees Fat Amy at the pump.
Slow down, Donald. Bumper lowers his window and sticks his body halfway out. holds a wrapped burrito in his hand.
(inside the van) Hey, isn’t that?--
Sabotage! It PEGS her, hard. Fat Bumper WHIPS the burrito at Fat Amy. She Amy FALLS up against the van and SLIDES down its side. GRABS at her stomach.
I've been shot! I think I’ve been shot! The ladies JUMP out of the van to tend to Fat Amy. The gu react, “Aw, shit!” Beca turns to find Cynthia Rose trying give Fat Amy mouth to mouth.
I'm sitting up! I’m talking! You don’t need to do that! Fat Amy looks down at the mess, smells it, then takes a b
Bumper threw a big ass burrito at me! Ugh! I will kill him! I/’11 pick my teeth with his bones!
Get up. We have to clean your shirt and we don’t have much time. Lilly puts the gas pump back. They barely put in six buck (CONTINUED)
Tell no one what you’ve seen today. (takes another bite) Damn. These are delicious. Scene 61 has been shot and completed. Editorially it 61 has been changed to now reflect 59C
THE GUYS APPLAUD BUMPER’S TAKE-DOWN.
Oh! She went down like a Tri-Delt!
(to Unicycle) So Tri-Delts go down?
Oh, I have no idea. They never talk to me.

The Bellas’s van drives down the highway, now with all th ladies packed tightly inside. Fat Amy drives. Aubrey sits shotgun, nervously playing with the pitch pipe. Beca, sitting directly behind Fat Amy, notices a little guacamo stuck in Fat Amy’s ear. Beca leans forward and wipes it o
You got yourself a little somethin’ somethin’ in there.
Back off. It fuels my hate fire. Beca laughs, goes to put her headphones on, but stops sho to enjoy the ride. From the back of the van, Chloe, on earbuds, sings Miley Cyrus's, “Party In The USA.”

SO I PUT MY HANDS UP/THEY’RE

I set fires to feel joy.

All good, boo. I’m The Driver. Jesse motions to Beca to come sit next to him by patting seat. She shakes her head, no, and motions to her girls. ANGLE ON: Bumper in the back of the bus. (CONTINUED)
So Bellas, glad we could chauffeur you to your latest Treble-whipping. What boring, estrogen-filled set have you prepared for us today?
Hey. You’re nothing but Manwich in a jacket. And I’m always hungry. So shut. Your. Mouth.

text: The Trebles bursting onto the scene. Bumper is holding th lst place trophy over his head. The Bellas are not far behind. The Trebles are loud and celebratory and ultimate interrupt the Tones’ performance.
When are you clowns going to quit pretending you’re in college and get a life?

Sounds like your wife on your birthday.
Are you looking for what I think you're looking for?

Io... (realizing Jason's size) .«.. would but I pulled a quad during our performance ... but if I did fight you, I would ... Bumper goes to “punch” Jason but stops just short of actu hitting him.

I would beat the talent out of you but I respect the ICCA's too much to taint the floor with your blood... But if I did I would - Jason does the same “near-miss” swing at Bumper’s head.
ARRR! Right to the E.R. For reconstructive head surgery! ANGLE ON: JOE, taunting Jesse.
Hey, you, hit me! Hit me!

How’s it going, foxy moxy? Wanna see something sexy? He lifts up his shirt and rubs his belly.

(to Aubrey and Chloe) If I get in there, there’s going to be dork parts caught in the storm drains of these streets for months. Chloe puts her hand on Fat Amy, “You’re not going anywher ANGLE ON: The two Donalds. Not wanting to actually fight, they just grapple with each other, moving back and forth. looks like intense dancing.
Seriously, I can’t hit you if you don’t take off your glasses!
I’m not just making a style- statement, these are prescription!
Well, then you better keep them on so you can see me punch you. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
Except I can’t punch you if you keep them on!

Classic Catch-22! They continue. Jason takes Bumper down in a head lock. Jo gets in Jesse’s face. UNI rides around in circles. Gail interviews socks. It’s chaos. ANGLE ON: The Bellas, watching. Some in horror. Some confused.
Aubrey, should we try to stop them?
They are our ride.

I don’t think anyone’s actually fighting? Fat Amy makes her way to JOE. JOE, really starting to lose it, taunts Jesse, Uni, Kolio and any of the other Trebles to go after him.
Hit me anywhere! I don’t care! (re: his chest) Right in the bread basket! Make it worth it! Back with Bumper and JASON, now wrestling on the ground.
You remind me of me when I was your age!
I am nothing like you... am I? Back with HAR MAR and Stacie:
You can’t resist this. Right now, the “danger” is sending blood straight to your woo-woo. (CONTINUED)
Har Mar puts Stacie’s hand on his belly. Stacie smiles.

You're so confusing to me. Are we both getting lucky, little man? HAR MAR just sticks his tongue out suggestively. After a beat, Stacie makes tongue swirls as well. ANGLE ON: JOE ripping open his shirt.
I’ve been unemployed since the Bush Administration, and am living out of that van. I deserve it! I’m spiritually numb. Give it to me! To settle him down, Jesse finally half-punches Joe.
Ok, there you go, guy. JOE, loving it, grabs the Treble trophy and whips it arou like an obsessed man.
Yes! Now hit me with the trophy! Use the sharp part! Jesse stands there, speechless. Fat Amy, unable to help herself, CHARGES at JOE and grabs the trophy. Beca goes a her.
The Kracken has been unleashed!
Oh boy. She goes to hit JOE with the trophy. Beca lunges for her, grabbing part of the trophy.

Noooo! Stop! Let go! Beca and Fat Amy push and pull on the trophy. Finally Fat lets go. By doing so, Beca can’t help but jerk the trophy back. A piece of it flies off, smashing the lobby window! Everyone looks on, stunned. A police officer happens to be ticketing the Tone van rig outside. When the window smashes, he looks up, right at B (CONTINUED)
Beca is standing there red-handed. Everyone else comicall darts in every direction.  79.
A proud Beca walks down the steps of the Police Station. Jesse is there, waiting with arms wide open.
Hey Hillary Swank in Million Dollar Baby.
You just have to say “Million Dollar Baby.” You don’t have to reference the actress.
I wanted to make sure you got it.
Thanks for bailing me out.
I didn’t. Jesse stops, gesturing down the way. ANGLE ON: DR. MITCHE standing outside of his car. Beca does a 180.
You called my dad?! Why?!
They put you in handcuffs, Bec. It looked pretty serious --
That doesn’t mean you call my Dad! (CONTINUED)
What, do you have another parent I don’t know about? (then, confused) Why are you yelling at me? I’m the only one here.
I didn’t ask you to be. Jesse reacts, stunned.
I was trying to help.
I don’t want your help. You’re not my boyfriend! Beca starts walking toward Dr. Mitchell. Jesse
Yeah, you've made that very clear.
(to Dr. Mitchell) Dad, it’s not a big deal --
It is a big deal. I get a call in the middle of the night telling me my only daughter got arrested for destruction of property!
It was a misunderstanding. I was protecting my friends! Putting myself out there! “Making memories”!
If you think I’m paying for you to live in LA after you pull a stunt like this? Well, I’m not. Get in the car.
Wait, don’t you want to listen to what I have to say?
Not tonight I don’t. 80. 70 follows. (CONTINUED)
Beca shoots Jesse daggers. DR. MITCHELL (CONT’D) Jesse gets shotgun.

Did they spray you with a hose?
Find yourself a bitch?
I did a turn at county.
(touched) You waited up for me?
Of course we waited up for you. ANGLE ON: Beca, clearly moved by this gesture.
(getting up) They’ve been here for hours. It’s a real inconvenience, Beca. Kimmy Jin exits. Aubrey blows the pitch pipe.
I’m calling an emergency Bella- meeting. Beca rolls her eyes as the girls gather.
First up? Our score sheet revealed that The Sockappellas almost beat us. We need to bust our asses if we're going to make it to the Finals. (CONTINUED)
Or try a new approach...
Enough with that, Beca.
Wait, listen, the reason why we almost lost to sock puppets is because they took a risk. Being good isn’t enough to win.

The audience loves the Trebles. They tolerate us. Aubrey, we could seriously change the face of a cappella if you would just let me teach you my music! (hearing herself) That sounded so queerballs. Subtle nods can be seen amongst the girls as Beca moves t her workstation and turns on her computer, keyboard, etc.
Look, I’ve been working on this arrangement... She starts playing the keyboard, and multi-tasking with h equipment. The music plays and the song gets more and mor layered.
I didn’t know you were into all this. The rest react, intriqued. Finally, Aubrey SNAPS BECA’S COMPUTER SCREEN SHUT.

You've caused enough distractions for one night. JI have the pitch pipe, and I say we focus on the set list. (to group, forceful) From now on, we eat, sleep, and pee rehearsal. No more wasting our time with work, school, boyfriends ... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
(looks to Cynthia Rose) Sorry, Cynthia Rose. Partners. Cynthia Rose reacts, confused.
Last year we were the first all- female group to get to the finals. I promise you that I’1l get us back there again.
I don’t know. Maybe Beca -- Aubrey holds up the ‘Zip it’ gesture. Chloe cowers.
Let’s get started. Aubrey marches out the door. The rest of the ladies follo her out. Beca just stands there, frustrated.
Luke is in the booth. Jesse is busy, working on the secon level. Over the PA, we can hear Beca’s music. Beca, dressed in her performance attire, RUNS in, super-psyched
Holy Crap, it’s my song! Luke, unable to hear her, steps out of the booth. BECA (CONT’D) You're finally playing it!
(pointing up, re: music) Tight Beats.
I’ve always thought her beats were tight. Beca and Luke loop up to Jesse on the second level. Then:
This is a killer vocal track. The deejay at “The Garage” does a brilliant mix of this song as well but yours is better. (CONTINUED)
(cocky) Yeah it is.
I’m going to hear her play tonight. You should come with and check her out.
Ugh, I can’t. I have this thing. Luke takes in Beca’s outfit.
Flight attendant training?
(smiles, sarcastic) Yeah, it’s a three-year program. I learn how to distribute pretzels and wave goodbye. (then) No, I’m a Barden Bella. Tonight’s the semi-finals.
Really? I would have never pinned you as one of those a cappella girls.
That’s ‘cause you don’t know Becky like I do. (CONTINUED)
Jesse gets up and walks past Beca.
(to Beca) See you tonight.
ON STAGE: The Co-ed group, THE FOOTNOTES, are on stage, i vests. A pint-sized freshman prodigy, TIMOTHY, has the mi and rocks out to The Jackson 5’s, “Blame It On The Boogie
The Bellas watch from the wings next to Benji, who wears P.A.’s headset and a Barden Performing Arts Center jacket
Five minutes, Bellas. The ladies are captivated by Timothy’s performance.
Where did he come from?
It's over. The season’s over. We can’t beat The Footnotes and The Trebles.
Wonder where they get their vests made? Aubrey turns to Beca, who looks like she’s hatching a pla She rallies the troops.
Aca-huddle! Now! The top TWO teams go to the finals. We just have to beat one of them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

If we do it exactly as we rehearsed, we'll get there. (to Beca) Exactly. As The Footnotes finish performing, TIMOTHY BOWS SEVERAL TIMES. BACKSTAGE: The ladies circle up to do “Hands in.” It’s still a struggle.
That little peanut can sing!
He sure can. Sounds like his boys haven't dropped, if you know what I mean.

If you mean his testicles, then yes. Yes I do, John. We all do. The Barden Bellas are up next. As the Bellas takes the stage, ANGLE ON: Beca, looking ou into the audience. The ladies begin “The Sign.”
And in true Bella style the ladies are sticking with what they know.

head_text.subj: AND IT OPENED UP MY EYES...

text: Beca’s eyes bounce from the low-energy audience, to the judges, to the audience. Finally, she makes a decision. From the back of the line and much to the Bellas’s surpri Beca pipes in with La Roux’s, “Bulletproof.” It matches perfectly. Aubrey shoots her a look.
Whoa. /Boom!
This. Is. Different. Beca’s “mash-up” revitalizes the audience. The judges lea forward. ANGLE ON: Luke, impressed. It’s awesome, until flustered, Aubrey flubs up a little choreography. (CONTINUED)
You know, it’s so important at these competitions to remember that it’s just a friendly collegiate contest and we’re all just out here to have fun.
So true, John. But a misstep here can haunt you for the rest of your life and affect your children.
The Trebles sit around, goofing off, as the next group ca heard on stage. A beat. An obviously upset Aubrey flings the backstage door open. The rest of the Bellas amble in behind her.
What the hell, Beca, were you trying to screw us up?
Are you serious? The Trebles, including Jesse, stop to listen.
This isn’t the Beca show!
Hey, in case you hadn’t noticed everyone pretty much dozed off during our set!

It’s not up to you to decide what we do and when we do it. Why don’t you ask the rest of the group how they felt about your little improvisation? The gang shuffles awkwardly for a beat, saying nothing.
(frustrated) Fat Amy? (CONTINUED)
I mean, it was cool and all, but... I guess it sorta took us a little by surprise. The other girls mumble reluctant agreement.
A lot by surprise. (to Chloe) I told you she wasn’t a Bella.
